meanings.definition: Incorrigibles (noun): People who are beyond correction or reform.
meanings.sent1: The group of incorrigibles in the class never listened to the teacher.
meanings.sent2: The judge decided to send the incorrigibles to a rehabilitation center.
meanings.sent3: The incorrigibles at the party kept playing pranks on everyone.
meanings.sent4: Her stubbornness made her seem like one of the incorrigibles.
meanings.sent5: The incorrigibles in the neighborhood were known for causing trouble.

meanings.definition: Incorrigibles (adjective): Unable to be corrected or reformed.
meanings.sent1: The teacher found the student's behavior to be incorrigibles.
meanings.sent2: The criminal's actions were deemed incorrigibles by the court.
meanings.sent3: Despite his best efforts, his incorrigibles behavior continued.
meanings.sent4: Her incorrigibles attitude towards authority caused many problems.
meanings.sent5: The old house had an incorrigibles leak that no one could fix.
